title: Indian Army Chief to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The Chief of the Army Staff of India, General Upendra Dwivedi is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on a two-day visit today, the Indian Defence Ministry has announced.

title: NIE approves removal of questionable lesson from Grade 6 English module: PM
byline: The National Institute of Education (NIE) has approved the removal of the questionable lesson from the Grade 6 English module which created huge controversy after it was confirmed that the material contained a reference to an inappropriate website, the Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has confirmed.

title: Special traffic plan around Kelaniya Temple for annual perahera
byline: Police have announced a special traffic plan in view of the annual Duruthu Perahera of the Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya.

title: Low-pressure system in Bay of Bengal currently about 700km from Batticaloa
byline: The low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal is currently situated about 700 km southeast of Batticaloa and is expected to approach Sri Lanka’s eastern coast by tomorrow (08), the Department of Meteorology has warned.

title: Electricity consumers to foot the bill for street lights?
byline: The proposed new electricity policy includes a proposal to recover the cost of street lighting in a given area from the electricity bills of area residents, the Electricity Consumers’ Association has claimed.

title: Four arrested in Jaffna for illegal possession and sale of prescription drugs
byline: A total of four individuals have been arrested in Jaffna along with a stock of prescription drugs that were being illegally sold.

title: Low-pressure area likely to intensify into depression during next 12 hours
byline: The low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal to the southeast of Sri Lanka is likely to intensify into a depression during the next 12 hours, the Department of Meteorology has stated.

title: Six dead and hundreds of flights cancelled as snow causes chaos across Europe
byline: Intense snowfall and icy weather conditions have caused widespread travel disruption across Europe, with six reported killed in weather-related incidents on the continent.

title: Trading at CSE temporarily halted
byline: Trading at the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has been temporarily halted due to unusual opening prices in Wealth Trust Securities Limited.

title: Fishermen advised not to venture into sea areas from Kankesanthurai to Hambantota via Trincomalee
byline: Naval and fishing communities have been warned not to venture to the deep and shallow sea areas extending from Kankesanthurai to Hambantota via Trincomalee and Pottuvil until further notice.

title: Man linked to Kohuwala shooting arrested in Badowita
byline: An individual linked to a recent shooting incident in which a girl sustained injuries in Bodhiyawatta, Kohuwala has been arrested.

title: Powerful magnitude 6.7 earthquake strikes near Baculin, Philippines, USGS says
byline: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck 68 km (42 miles) east of Baculin in the Philippines, at a depth of 10 km (6 miles) on Wednesday, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) said.

title: US discussing options to acquire Greenland, including use of military, says White House
byline: US President Donald Trump has been discussing “a range of options” to acquire Greenland, including use of the military, the White House said.

title: US Ambassador Julie Chung to depart Sri Lanka after four-year tenure
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung will depart Sri Lanka on January 16 after almost four years of dedicated service, marking the conclusion of her tenure as the United States’ top diplomat in Colombo, according to the U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka.

title: Renowned inventor Rohan De Lanerolle secures five awards at Asia Awards 2026
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan inventor Rohan De Lanerolle Snr has won five prestigious awards at the Asia Awards 2026 held in India.

title: iPhone will get 200MP cameras in 2028, says Morgan Stanley
byline: Researchers from investment bank Morgan Stanley say Apple will add Samsung’s 200MP cameras to the iPhone in 2028, and also add suppliers to potentially reduce costs.

title: Trump says Venezuela will send up to 50 million barrels of oil to US
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday (Jan 6) that Venezuela’s interim government will deliver up to 50 million barrels of oil to the United States, and that the proceeds “will be controlled by me” as president.

title: Opposition MPs begin signing no-confidence motion against Education Minister
byline: Opposition members of Parliament have commenced signing a no-confidence motion against Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Landslide evacuation warnings issued for three DS areas extended
byline: The Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warnings issued for three Divisional Secretariat divisions in two districts have been extended by the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO).

title: NIE approves removal of questionable lesson from Grade 6 English module: PM Harini
byline: The National Institute of Education (NIE) has approved the removal of the questionable lesson from the Grade 6 English module which created huge controversy after it was confirmed that the material contained a reference to an inappropriate website, the Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has confirmed.

title: Indian Army Chief arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The Chief of the Army Staff of India, General Upendra Dwivedi, arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago on a two-day official visit, the Indian Ministry of Defence announced.

title: Vehicular movement on Somawathiya Road suspended due to overflow of Mahaweli River
byline: Vehicular movement along the Somawathiya–Sungavila Road has been suspended with effect from 8:30 a.m. today (07), following severe flooding caused by the overflow of the Mahaweli River, according to the Pulasthipura Police.

title: Discussion underway to table No-Confidence Motion against Education Minister
byline: The opposition is preparing to table a no-confidence motion against Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Seaplane plunges into Gregory Lake in Nuwara Eliya
byline: A seaplane that was preparing to land plunged into Gregory Lake in Nuwara Eliya at around 12:30 p.m. today (07).

title: Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill presented to Parliament by Justice Minister
byline: The Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill, which seeks to repeal the Parliamentary Pensions Law (No. 1 of 1979), has been presented in Parliament.

title: Sri Lanka Police officers donate day’s salary to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ fund
byline: Officers of the Sri Lanka Police have contributed Rs. 50 million, equivalent to one day’s salary, to the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established to restore livelihoods and rebuild the country following the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: USD/LKR Spot Rate surpasses Rs. 310 mark for the first time since Feb. 2024
byline: The indicative USD/LKR spot rate quoted by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has surpassed the Rs. 310 mark for the first time since 29 February 2024.

title: Sri Lanka, EU sign EUR 8 mln grant agreement for AgriGreen Initiative
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has signed a grant agreement valued at EUR 8 million with the European Union to launch a new initiative under the AgriGreen Initiative – Green Economic Growth through Sustainable Agriculture Practices project.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Two remanded for allegedly assisting Ishara Sewwandi
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of Nanda Kumar Thakshee and another individual until January 9, following their arrest for allegedly aiding, abetting, and providing shelter to Ishara Sewwandi, the primary suspect in the murder of underworld figure ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’.

title: Sri Lanka and Germany sign debt restructuring agreement worth Euro 188 million
byline: Sri Lanka and Germany have entered into a bilateral agreement in relation to the external debt restructuring process, the Ministry of Finance said in a statement.

title: Heavy showers above 100 mm predicted in several areas
byline: Heavy showers above 100 mm have been predicted at some places in the Eastern and Uva provinces and in the Polonnaruwa, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: CSE cancels all equity trading conducted before today’s market halt
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has announced that it has decided to cancel all equity securities transactions carried out today (07) prior to the market halt, following the detection of transactions executed at irregular prices.

title: Youth arrested at BIA with ‘Kush cannabis’ valued at Rs. 70 mn
byline: An individual who arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with a consignment of the ‘Kush cannabis’ valued at approximately Rs. 70 million has been arrested.

title: Low-pressure area in Bay of Bengal intensified into depression
byline: The low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal to the southeast of Sri Lanka has intensified into a depression and is centered near latitude 4.9°N and longitude 87.4°E, about 700 km southeast of Pottuvil at 11.30 a.m. today (07), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Guidelines on cybersecurity planned for education sector officials
byline: Steps have been taken to prepare a code of guidelines on cyber security for officials involved in curriculum development, as well as the preparation and review of school textbooks.

title: All crew members of seaplane which plunged into Gregory Lake are safe – Operators
byline: Crew members of the Amphibian aircraft which plunged into Gregory Lake in Nuwara Eliya this afternoon (07) were unharmed, the Saffron Aviation (Pvt) Ltd which operates Cinnamon Air aircraft has stated.

title: Russia sends navy to guard oil tanker being pursued by US forces
byline: Russia has reportedly deployed a submarine and other vessels to escort an oil tanker - which is also being pursued by US forces - across the Atlantic.

title: Professor Charitha Herath appointed to SJB Working Committee
byline: Former Member of Parliament Professor Charitha Herath has been appointed to the Working Committee of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Death toll rises to 7 in Waikkala illicit liquor incident; Suspects remanded
byline: The death toll from the incident related to the consumption of illicit liquor in the Waikkala area of Wennappuwa has risen to seven.

title: No parliamentary pensions after bill enacted – Justice Minister
byline: The Minister of Justice and National Integration, Attorney-at-Law Harshana Nanayakkara, has stated that once the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill, which seeks to repeal the Parliamentary Pensions Law, is enacted, no Member of Parliament will be entitled to receive a pension.

title: Port City Economic Commission Bill passed without amendments
byline: The Colombo Port City Economic Commission Bill has been passed in Parliament today (07) without amendments, following its third reading.

title: Public invited to contribute to “National Visual Chronicle” on Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The President’s Media Division (PMD), in collaboration with the Clean Sri Lanka Secretariat, is compiling a National Visual Chronicle documenting the impact of Cyclone Ditwah on Sri Lanka and the subsequent recovery process.

title: Trump’s oil push widens with seizure of Russian-flagged tanker linked to Venezuela
byline: The U.S. said on Wednesday it had seized a Russian-flagged, Venezuela-linked tanker as part of President Donald Trump’s aggressive push to dictate oil flows in the Americas and force Caracas’ socialist government to become its ally.
